item.title: Palworld Update 0.6.4 Hits One Pal Harder Than the Rest
item.description:
Palworld just recently released a fresh update with patch 0.6.4, and while many of the fixes were intended to balance the game, it also marks the end of an era for one of the newest Pals to hit the scene. With each update, Palworld has continued to grow, making it a stronger experience over time, and that includes regularly updating its Pal roster.

One of the most substantial balance updates featured in Palworld 's 0.6.4 patch is the change to Trigger Happy. It's no secret that Trigger Happy was incredibly overpowered for newcomers Finsider and Finsider Ignis, and while this ability nerf was necessary to make the game as balanced as possible, it's also sad to see the overpowered nature of these Pals get brought down, even if it's slight.

Palworld's Latest Update Takes Finsider Ignis' Power Down a Peg

Being a variant of Finsider, what makes Finsider Ignis such a strong Pal is that it isn't just a Water type like its original version, but also a Fire type as well. This gives Finsider Ignis a special punch, and with Trigger Happy, the Pal quickly gained a reputation for being an incredibly overpowered option. Since its launch in early access, Palworld has faced a variety of ups and downs with its many updates, but ultimately, Finsider Ignis' Trigger Happy being less potent is the right decision in the long run. It was fun while it lasted, but it was simply far too powerful of a skill.

Finsider was added to Palworld in the recent Tides of Terraria update that launched on June 25.

Despite the Nerf, Finsider is Still a Strong Pal Well Worth the Time

Yes, patch 0.6.4 nerfed Trigger Happy, but honestly, it still may be one of the best skills in the game. The biggest difference is that it's just not the most powerful skill in an obviously overwhelming way. Even most Finsider Ignis lovers can agree that Trigger Happy was far too powerful to stay in its state forever, but it's at least still incredibly effective. Crafting one's Pal lineup in Palworld takes a lot of thought and care, depending on one's preference, and Finsider Ignis is a great option to have on one's roster.

A dual-pistol-wielding Pal seems like a novelty at first, but Finsider has proven to be incredibly useful since arriving in the game. Finsider and Finsider Ignis may have only been part of Palworld for a short time now, but the Pals have quickly become beloved by a lot of players, and for good reason.

Being a variant of Finsider, what makes Finsider Ignis such a strong Pal is that it isn't just a Water type like its original version, but also a Fire type as well.

Players who want their very own Finsider are able to find the Pal during both nighttime and daytime on Sunlit Isle . Those looking specifically for Finsider Ignis can fish for the Pal at Feybreak Island and Phantom Isle .

Palworld's Tides of Terraria Update is a Major Milestone for the Game

Finsider was far from the only addition featured in the Tides of Terraria update. This crossover with the beloved sandbox hit marks the first major collaboration with another game for Palworld , opening the doors for more major partnerships in the future.

As Palworld continues to grow and evolve, it will be fascinating to see what other collaborations are in store for the game. Even more thrilling, with each crossover, new Pals are bound to be added to the mix, further expanding the game's ever-growing roster. So far, the future of Palworld looks bright, and as more Pals continue to appear, other powerful options like Finsider and Finsider Ignis will likely make their way to the game's world.

item.title: Dead by Daylight Overhauling Kill Switch System
item.description:
Dead by Daylight developer Behaviour Interactive has confirmed plans to overhaul the game’s Kill Switch system following player backlash and confusion in regards to a lack of clarity regarding the feature's requirements. More specifically, the move comes after the Dead by Daylight community nominated the Streetwise perk for temporary removal due to an unresolved exploit, but were told by Behaviour that the issue failed to meet its Kill Switch criteria.

Back in June 2025, Dead by Daylight set a new player count record of 106,029 concurrent users following the release of its highly anticipated Five Nights at Freddy’s update. Proving to be a popular month for Dead by Dayligh t, the game’s previous all-time player count was recorded in June 2021 following the game’s Resident Evil crossover with 105,093 concurrent users.

Dead by Daylight Perk Getting the Kill Switch

The Streetwise perk for Nea previously allowed players to increase the Efficiency of Items and extend the effect to other Survivors in an 8-meter radius. Following the release of Dead by Daylight ’s 9.1.0 update, however, Streetwise was changed to instead increase the number of Charges for Items retrieved from Chests. Naturally, there were Dead by Daylight players who figured out a way to exploit Streetwise and use it to infinitely boost Charges. After this was pointed out and requests came in asking Behaviour for a Kill Switch fix, the developer initially responded by suggesting the issue failed to meet the necessary criteria, resulting in community backlash.

Behaviour has since taken note of player frustration over Streetwise failing to meet its Kill Switch criteria and released a statement confirming it’s “immediately rebuilding” Kill Switch to be “more nimble and better account for community sentiment.” With this, Behaviour assures that once a new Kill Switch process has been settled upon, the team will offer clearer communication on how to trigger it. Furthermore, Behaviour changed its mind and has now officially decided to throw the Kill Switch on Streetwise, along with Blood Rush, and the Last Stand perk for Michonne who was recently added to Dead by Daylight via its The Walking Dead crossover.

Behaviour makes regular changes to Dead by Daylight ’s formula, but doesn’t always make these changes explicitly clear to players. After the developer released the game’s 9.0.2 Bugfix Patch back in July 2025, players noticed the Twisted Masquerade event for Dead by Daylight wasn’t spawning as many anniversary cakes as it had in previous years. After some silence, Behaviour shared a brief statement to Reddit confirming it was aware of players receiving fewer anniversary cakes, and that this wasn’t a bug but rather something that was “intended.”

In addition to taking steps to better address community concerns, like with its upcoming Kill Switch overhaul, Behaviour has also been working to regularly add and re-add highly requested content, with fan-favorite limited-time modifiers like Chaos Shuffle possibly returning to Dead by Daylight according to a recently shared leak posted to the LeaksDBD subreddit. With this in mind, it'll be interesting to see whether Behaviour will continue the trend of heeding player feedback in future content releases and patches for Dead by Daylight .

item.title: Best Open-World Games For Feeling Like An Explorer
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games must balance exploration with other gameplay pillars to engage players.
  • Starfield and Death Stranding offer unique and rewarding exploration experiences.
  • Kenshi and Outer Wilds provide depth and challenge in exploration-centric gameplay.

Open-world games need to ensure that their sandboxes are always fun to explore , encouraging players to check out undiscovered nooks and crannies to find something special. That being said, exploration is just one solitary gameplay pillar in most open-world games, with other facets of their gameplay taking over from time to time.

However, there are some open-world games that do a great job of letting players feel like genuine explorers . Uncovering unique locations and enjoying gameplay that rewards players for exploring is a huge part of what makes these games so special.

Starfield

Exploring New Planets Is A Huge Part Of The Gameplay Loop

Starfield
10 /10
64
8.2 /10
Released
September 6, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Suggestive Themes, Use of Drugs, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Starfield can feel a bit dated at times, with the overabundance of loading screens and procedurally generated planets taking away from the game's enjoyment. However, players who look past these issues will love what Starfield brings to the table.

Bethesda's spacefaring adventure allows for moments of fun exploration, as long as players ignore the meaningless planets with uninteresting locations. Once players understand that the environments are handcrafted, they'll love roleplaying as a space explorer in Starfield .

No Man's Sky

Flying In Space And Heading To Different Planets Feels Great

5 Images
5 Images
No Man's Sky
7 /10
61
9.3 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Powered by

No Man's Sky turned its reputation around to become one of the better space exploration games that players can check out. The title is loaded with so much content that players can easily spend hundreds of hours exploring.

Reaching the center of the universe is just the start of a player's adventure. They can explore a ton of planets in this gargantuan game and have a great time in one of the most feature-rich open-world sci-fi games they can get their hands on.

Death Stranding

Players Explore A Post-Apocalyptic World That Is Surprisingly Peaceful

Death Stranding
4 /10
27
7.7 /10
Released
November 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Powered by

A game that split fans down the middle when it released, more and more people eventually came to appreciate Death Stranding 's brilliance. Instead of focusing on a tried-and-tested gameplay loop, Death Stranding tried to be weird and ended up standing out quite a bit as a result.

Sam Porter Bridges must deliver packages across a ravaged United States, escaping deadly BTs and trying to deal with cargo thieves along the way. The act of movement is the biggest part of the gameplay loop and will keep fans engaged as they explore this hauntingly beautiful world and uncover its many secrets.

Kenshi

Exploration Is Just One Of The Many Things That Can Occupy Players In This Game

Kenshi
10.0 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Powered by

Kenshi is one of the most underrated open-world games on the market. Unlike most other games in the genre, players don't have a pre-determined goal or a detailed questline to follow.

Instead, their background decides where they start, following which they'll struggle to survive in a world that will chew them up and spit them out in a flash. Once players improve their skills and amass a decently powerful squad, they'll love exploring the game's desolate wasteland and uncovering the many secrets it has to offer.

Sunless Skies

Being A Skyfaring Explorer Is Both Exciting And Eerie

6 Images
6 Images
Sunless Skies
10.0 /10
Released
January 31, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Blood, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Exploration is the name of the game in Sunless Skies . While players can choose one of many different goals to focus on in any run, they'll have to explore multiple locations to achieve what they've set their mind to.

This is the meat and bones of the title, and it feels great, with the game's eerie horror vibes making the simple act of moving from point A to point B deeply unnerving. Thankfully, as long as players have low Terror and decent weapons, they should be able to explore the tougher locations in the game without feeling overwhelmed.

Outer Wilds

Knowledge Is The Currency That Drives This Game's Progress, And It Is Acquired Through Exploration

Outer Wilds
9.2 /10
Released
May 28, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ due to Fantasy Violence, Alcohol Reference
Powered by

Players who want to check out one of the most compelling open-world games ever made will love what Outer Wilds brings to the table. Once they get used to flying around and landing on different planets, collecting information will feel quite natural.

This is why Outer Wilds struck such a major chord with players; they loved how effortless yet engrossing the simple act of exploration was. Uncovering the secrets of the world and making slow yet meaningful progress ensures that Outer Wilds will leave a lasting impression on players, especially after a certain moment when everything clicks.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Dragonborn Can Become A Seasoned Explorer In No Time

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Bethesda struck gold with Skyrim . The game lets players mold the Dragonborn into whatever image they wish before taking their sweet time ignoring the main story and getting lost in the simple act of exploration.

The memorable locations in Skyrim will never cease to be jaw-dropping, especially if players use mods to enhance the game's visual fidelity. The massive world is full of so many things to uncover that players can get lost for hours on end as the magic of exploration grabs hold of them.

The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

The Zen, Rewarding Exploration Is One Of The Game's Biggest Strengths

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
60
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Tears of the Kingdom is one of the greatest open-world games of all time, serving as a natural and excellent evolution from Breath of the Wild . If players loved the exploration in the Nintendo Switch's launch title, then Tears of the Kingdom will be even better in this regard.

Aside from the overworld in the first game, which is changed up just enough to feel unique, players can now explore the Sky Islands. If the scope of these floating locations isn't impressive enough, then jumping into the Depths will make it clear just how much untouched real estate there is to discover in this amazing title.

item.title: Battlefield 6 is Taking Inspiration from the Best Games in the Franchise
item.description:
Developers at Battlefield Studios working on Battlefield 6 say that some of the best games in the series, such as Battlefield 4 and Bad Company 2 , are the main inspiration for the latest entry. Battlefield 6 was officially unveiled recently, and will launch on October 10, 2025.

Excitement is building for the Battlefield series ahead of the upcoming Battlefield 6 beta test, which is setting player milestones months before the game is even due for release. Part of the reason for all this anticipation is the community-involved Battlefield Labs playtest program, which gathered feedback from fans to help drive development decisions. The results so far have been hailed as a return to the "glory days" of beloved Battlefield games like Battlefield 3 and 4 , considered high points for the series.

Battlefield 6 Developer Says Battlefield 3, 4, and Bad Company 2 Heavily Inspired Them

The seeming similarity of Battlefield 6 to the likes of Battlefield 3 and 4 isn't an accident, given the words of the developers themselves. Speaking with Gamesradar, Criterion Games User Experience Director Alan Pimm said that Battlefield 3 and 4 acted as the "strongest muses" for Battlefield 6 . This was particularly true in terms of tone and framing. Pimm said that in the studio's research with fans, the most desired theme was modern, as opposed to the more "ultra-modern or futuristic" settings of games like Battlefield 2042 or 2142 . Pimm said that players wanted "the weapons of today," in a setting that seems "gritty and real." Indeed, the Battlefield 6 war between the US and Pax Armata takes place in the surprisingly close future of 2027, as a result of the apparent breakup of the NATO military alliance.

It's not surprising that Battlefield 3 and 4 were major inspirations for Battlefield 6 , but in an interview, DICE Lead Multiplayer Producer Jeremy Chubb told PC Gamer that Battlefield Bad Company 2 also served as a "huge inspiration" to Battlefield 6 . Despite being regarded as something of a spin-off title, Bad Company 2 had a famously expansive approach to environmental destruction, allowing players to level practically every building on the map over time. Not even the beloved Battlefield 3 and 4 went that far, reigning in dynamic destruction in favor of large-scale, map-altering scripted events baked into each map. Chubb referred to Bad Company 2 's "intimate destructive experience" as something that the teams "really wanted to go back to" for Battlefield 6.

All in all, it looks like Battlefield Studios is looking to the best and most popular Battlefield games as guidestones to drive its creation of Battlefield 6 . With luck, those efforts to recapture the series' "golden age" will pay off as players jump into the beta and final release.

item.title: Ready or Not - Home Invasion: Lawmaker Guide (All Objectives)
item.description:
The Lawmaker mission from the Home Invasion DLC in Ready or Not is fairly straightforward, but it can be a challenge for players who aren't comfortable with close-quarters fights. This mission is set in a large mansion overtaken by a group of radicals, so expect a lot of room-to-room engagements.

While Lawmaker isn't as complex as some other Ready or Not missions, it's still set in a large map with plenty of doors and angles to worry about. Clearing this level is going to be tricky, but with enough practice and preparation, players will be able to finish it in no time at all.

Updated August 5, 2025 by Marc Santos: Lawmaker is one of the more difficult maps to clear in Ready or Not thanks to its layout, and with the deadlier NPCs added to the game when the console version launched, it became an even harder mission to complete. We've updated this guide to include a segment with tips on how to get S-rank on Lawmaker.

All Lawmaker Objectives in Ready or Not

Lawmaker is another indoor CQB map similar to the Dorms map in Ready or Not . Most encounters here will be in rooms and hallways, though there are a few long sightlines, such as the main entrance lobby and the backyard. In this mission, your objectives are:

  • Bring Order to Chaos: Arrest or neutralize all suspects in the area.
  • Rescue All Civilians: Restrain all unarmed civilians.
  • Locate Active Panic Rooms: Make contact with the family hiding in one of the mansion's panic rooms.
  • Rescue Sven Anderson-Lincoln: Rescue the owner of the house.

Lawmaker Panic Room Locations

There are two panic rooms in the mansion , and the one you're looking for is the one with the red, flashing light. If the panic room you find does not have this light active, you can safely ignore it.

  • One panic room is on the second floor, next to the spiral staircase in the middle of the mansion.
  • The other panic room is inside the dressing room next to the master bedroom on the third floor.

All you need to do is interact with the exterior keypad of the active panic room. Doing so will prompt a response from the family inside, crossing this objective off the list.

Where to Find Sven Anderson-Lincoln

Sven, the owner of the mansion, can be anywhere on the map . He is a middle-aged man wearing casual attire, and he will yell distinct voicelines that should be easy to distinguish from the other civilians. He spawns on the third floor more often than not, and he almost always has at least one suspect guarding him.

Lawmaker has no soft objectives. Focus on getting every suspect and civilian out alive if you want to get an S-rank clear.

Tips and Recommended Loadouts

Suspects here are armored and armed with high-caliber weaponry , including AK rifles and Five Seven pistols. They'll have an easy time penetrating your armor, so we recommend using Ceramic or Steel plates on a light rig to balance protection with mobility. A ballistic shield can also work if you're with a coordinated group, but in general, it's better to avoid getting hit here instead of taking shots. Additionally, bring and use some flashlights, as some rooms can be a bit dark.

To make matters worse, the suspects in Lawmaker have a tendency to use civilians as human shields. Use flashbangs or CS gas when you know there's a suspect in the room, as there's a decent chance that they're holding someone hostage. If you're using a pepperball launcher, shoot the floor under the suspects . This will cause them to start coughing without risking any unauthorized use of force penalties against possible human shields.

Here are some tips for the Lawmaker mission:

  • The mansion is huge . We strongly recommend doing a thorough, systematic sweep of every room starting at the first floor.
  • Use AP rifle rounds. Suspects are equipped with bulletproof vests that can give low-caliber HP ammo trouble.
  • Start at the rear entrance . The main entrance can be hard to breach since there could be suspects on the second floor watching the door.
  • On lethal playthroughs, aim for the head . This should help with unexpected human shield encounters. There are no arrest requirements for the mission.

How to Get S-Rank in Ready or Not: Lawmaker Mission

Lawmaker is a tough mission to clear, and even tougher if you plan to get an S-rank for it. The mansion has tons of dangerous angles, and it's very easy to get lost in it. If trying to clear this mission perfectly is starting to get frustrating, try the following tips and tactics out:

  • Start from the back or side entrance . The closest rooms here are easier to breach than the main entrance, though suspects might be present if you enter from the pool area.
  • Bring an Optiwand . It doesn't matter if you're playing solo or co-op. An Optiwand will help you assess if the next door you're about to open is dangerous, or if the room contains a VIP.
  • Check the security cameras . There's a security room to the right of the main entrance. Here, you can potentially see the locations of suspects and VIPs.
  • Use gas . Since suspects have a tendency to take human shields in this mission, CS Gas may prove invaluable to safely securing everyone.
  • Take it slow . The map is enormous, and there are plenty of rooms to search. Be thorough, and clear the level one floor and one room at a time.
  • When in doubt, shout . Suspects will react to you if you yell at them for compliance. If you're not sure if there's someone nearby, yell, and someone might yell back.
